example_sentence_english: I would like to bring the meeting forward.
I am bringing the meeting forward.
The amount is brought forward.
The date is brought forward.
The terms are brought forward.
The deliveries are brought forward.
I bring the payment forward.
Do you bring the departure forward?

translation_english: he brings forward/she brings forward/you (formal) bring forward
example_sentence_english: You (formal) bring the closing forward.
We bring the schedule forward.
You (plural) bring things forward too much.
They bring the race forward.
I was always bringing payments forward.
Were you usually bringing the class forward?

translation_english: he was bringing forward/she was bringing forward/you (formal) were bringing forward
example_sentence_english: You (formal) were bringing the delivery forward.
We were often bringing meetings forward.
You (plural) were bringing it forward by a day.
They were bringing the meetings forward.
I have brought the invoice forward.
You have brought it forward too much.

translation_english: he has brought forward/she has brought forward/you (formal) have brought forward
notes: used with auxiliary avere; also used as formal "Lei"
example_sentence_english: He has brought the deadline forward.
We have brought the timing forward.
You (plural) have brought the sending forward.
They have brought the trip forward.
